head.title: Andres Martinez Named Times Editorial Writer

hedline.hl1: Andres Martinez Named Times Editorial Writer

abstract.p: Andres Martinez, editorial writer for Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, joins New York Times as editorial writer (S)

block.p: Andres Martinez, an editorial writer for The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, has joined The New York Times as an editorial writer. His appointment to the editorial board was announced yesterday by Howell Raines, the editorial page editor.

Mr. Martinez was a member of the Post-Gazette editorial board, with the title of associate editor, from 1995 to 1997, and rejoined it last year. He wrote editorials and bylined articles on international affairs, national politics, business trends and other issues.

Andres Martinez, an editorial writer for The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, has joined The New York Times as an editorial writer. His appointment to the editorial board was announced yesterday by Howell Raines, the editorial page editor.

Mr. Martinez was a member of the Post-Gazette editorial board, with the title of associate editor, from 1995 to 1997, and rejoined it last year. He wrote editorials and bylined articles on international affairs, national politics, business trends and other issues.

In 1997 he joined The Wall Street Journal as a reporter. He left in 1998 to write a book, ''24/7: Living It Up and Doubling Down in the New Las Vegas'' (Villard, 1999), a journalistic look at the city's growth and some of the characters who call it home.

Mr. Martinez, 34, graduated cum laude from Yale in 1988 and earned a master's degree in history from Stanford and a law degree from Columbia Law School, where he was a member of The Law Review. He then served as a law clerk in Dallas for a federal district judge, Jerry Buchmeyer, and worked as an associate at Verner, Liipfert, Bernhard, McPherson & Hand in Washington.
